授業目的: As a compulsory basic course for management majors, this course aims to offer opportunities to discuss foundational theories and frameworks to examine how international business organizations should be managed. We build on foundational ideas discussed in “Management” to see how we should extend our key learning in the core course for unique context of international business organizations. We also try to closely tie our learning with other basic courses, “Corporate Strategy” in particular. Students are also encouraged to identify their own learning agenda as their preparation for advanced courses, including “Human Resource Management” and “Cross-Cultural Management” among others.
到達目標:
Learning goals for this course are threefold.
1. Understand unique challenges and opportunities for international business organizations
2. Understand roles and responsibilities for managers of international business organizations by extending key learning in “Management” and by closely connecting with other basic courses, “Corporate Strategy” in particular
3. Identify learning agenda in advanced courses, including “Human Resource Management” and “Cross-Cultural Management” among others.
授業の概要・背景: This course is conducted by a mixture of lectures and class discussions on selected international business cases. For each session, the lecturer introduces theories and concepts relevant to the case story, followed by active case discussion. Class discussions are focused on issues and challenges described in the case, as well as approaches employed to overcome these challenges. Students are expected to prepare for class discussions by reviewing case materials before the class.
授業方法: All lectures are conducted completely face-to-face.

第1回:
Introduction, challenges and opportunities for international business
We start the course with a brief introduction of topics we plan to discuss in this course. Then, we will examine some key issues students will face as managers of international business organizations. Unique opportunities and challenges associated with international competition will be introduced for further discussions in the following sessions.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第2回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第3回:
Developmental stages of international business
Traditional understanding is that firms gradually internationalize their business as they accumulate resources and experiences. We examine various developmental stages by discussing their underlying mechanisms as well as alternative entry modes into new country markets. We also discuss an emerging view that some firms are born global.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第4回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第5回:
Global integration and adaptation to local competitive conditions 
One of the major arguments for internationalization is a pursuit for replication opportunities of successful strategic as well as operational initiatives. It also is necessary, however, to properly adapt to competitive conditions unique to host country markets, including customer preferences, competitive pressure, and regulation. We will discuss how managers of international business should reconcile these mutually contradictory requirements by building on foundational discussion on differentiation and integration.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第6回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第7回:
Leveraging global and local human resources
Human resources can be both resources and constraints, depending on how properly they are managed. This is particularly the case for international business organizations because managers are expected to manage human resources with diverse behavioral and cognitional patterns. We review foundational discussion on coordination and control, motivation, as well as leadership to build on them for deeper understanding of effective management of global and local human resources at international business.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第8回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第9回:
Network of country subsidiaries as a source of global innovation 
One of the most important sources of competitive advantages of international business is its network of country subsidiaries as a source of global innovation. Exactly because they face wide varieties of local competitive conditions, they enjoy opportunities to have more novel ideas which may be globally leveraged for further competitiveness. We build on foundational discussion on knowledge-based view of the firm to discuss how managers of international business organizations can effectively exploit these opportunities.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第10回: Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第11回:
Cooperative rivalry between headquarters and country subsidiaries
International business is unique in that their intra-organizational relationships should be managed as inter-organizational relationships. This can be particularly challenging when country subsidiaries are powerful and influential in comparison with the headquarters. We discuss some key ideas on effective management of inter-organizational relationships to deepen our understanding of how managers of international business should effectively address this challenge.
Read assigned articles. Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.

Final report presentation
In the last session, students are asked to present their final report, followed by Q&A sessions with classmates.
